metadata.use_case: Common data model for colon cancer screening data
metadata.description: This is a common data model for cervical cancer screening data to produce key quality performance indicators.

variables.label: person_id
variables.description: Unique person identifier

variables.label: person_id_type
variables.description: Defines if the id is linkable accross the screening rounds per person (1) or if the id is just provided to hand out demographic information for single person given single screening round.

variables.label: bi_date
variables.description: Birth date of a person

variables.label: de_date
variables.description: Date of death (if exists)

variables.label: de_cause
variables.description: Cause of death (if exists)

variables.label: bi_country
variables.description: Birth country

variables.label: ethnicity
variables.description: Race of person

variables.label: bi_country_parents
variables.description: Birth country of a person's parents

variables.label: sex
variables.description: Sex  at the beginning of screening round.

rules.name: person_id_not_null
rules.description: Ensures the unique person identifier is not null to maintain relational integrity.

rules.name: person_id_type_check
rules.description: Validates if the ID is linkable across rounds (1) or round-specific (2).

rules.name: sex_values_check
rules.description: Restricts sex values to the defined codes: 1 (Men), 2 (Women), or NULL.
rules.expression: sex IN (1, 2) OR sex IS NULL

rules.name: death_consistency
rules.description: Ensures that a cause of death (de_cause) cannot exist without a date of death (de_date).
rules.expression: CASE WHEN de_cause IS NOT NULL THEN de_date IS NOT NULL ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: chronological_dates
rules.description: Verifies that the date of death is not chronologically earlier than the date of birth.
rules.expression: de_date >= bi_date OR de_date IS NULL

rules.name: age_screening_check
rules.description: Ensures the individual was born before the study period began (2025).

rules.name: alive_during_study
rules.description: Confirms the person was alive during the 2025 study period or has no recorded death date.

rules.name: iso_country_format
rules.description: Validates that the birth country follows the ISO-3166-1 alpha-3 code length (3 characters).

params.options_weights: Acute myocardial infarction:1, Pneumonia:1, Congestive heart failure:1, Ischemic stroke:1, Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD):1, Sepsis:1, Type 2 diabetes mellitus:1, Chronic kidney failure:1, Lung cancer:1, Alzheimer’s disease:1, Essential hypertension:1, Breast cancer:1, Alcoholic liver disease:1, Intracerebral hemorrhage:1, Parkinson’s disease:1, Liver cirrhosis:1, Suicide by intentional self-harm:1, Acute myeloid leukemia:1, Colon cancer:1, Traffic accident:1

DEU:1, AND:1, AUT:1, BEL:1, DNK:1, SVK:1, SVN:1, ESP:1, EST:1, FIN:1, FRA:1, GRC:1, HUN:1, IRL:1, ITA:1, LVA:1, LIE:1, LTU:1, LUX:1, MLT:1, NOR:1, NLD:1, POL:1, PRT:1, CZE:1, ROU:1, SWE:1, CHE:1, UKR:1

African:0, African American:0, Alaska Native:0, American Indian:5, American Indian or Alaska Native:0, Arab:0, Asian:5, Asian Indian:0, Bahamian:0, Bangladeshi:0, Barbadian:0, Bhutanese:0, Black:10, Black or African American:0, Burmese:0, Cambodian:0, Chinese:4, Dominica Islander:0, Dominican:0, European:60, Filipino:0, Haitian:0, Hmong:0, Indonesian:0, Iwo Jiman:0, Jamaican:0, Japanese:2, Korean:0, Laotian:0, Madagascar:0, Malaysian:0, Maldivian:0, Melanesian:0, Micronesian:0, Middle Eastern or North African:10, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander:0, Nepalese:0, Okinawan:0, Other Pacific Islander:0, Pakistani:2, Polynesian:0, Singaporean:0, Sri Lankan:0, Taiwanese:0, Thai:0, Tobagoan:0, Trinidadian:0, Vietnamese:0, West Indian:0, White:0, Non-white:0, Other Race:0, Unknown:2

variables.label: person_id
variables.description: ID of a person

variables.label: round_id
variables.description: ID of this particular screening round instance
variables.observations_comments: This id is linked to other phases in the screening programme, eg. everything from primary to interval phase.

variables.label: screening_year
variables.description: Year of the screening round instance

variables.label: round_specification_id
variables.description: ID of a screening round (that gives specifics to that particular screening programme)
variables.observations_comments: External ID that can be linked to screening round metadata -- not used yet.

variables.label: previous_round_id
variables.description: ID (round_id) of the previous screening round instance.
variables.observations_comments: This id links to the previous screening round instance of the same screening programme, making screening rounds form a chain. If it is not possible to have a link between two screening rounds, can be left empty.

variables.label: screening_previous_attendance
variables.description: Attendance in the previous screening round.

variables.label: screening_round_number
variables.description: Ordering number of current screening round, f.ex. 2 for second round.

variables.label: screening_history_string
variables.description: String of form '00100' indicating zeroes for non-attended round and ones for attended rounds in the past. Leave NA if not known or if only partially known.

variables.label: primary_invitation_type
variables.description: Screening setting, organized population-based or opportunistic

variables.label: screening_round_begin
variables.description: A date, when this screening round is considered to begin.
variables.observations_comments: If the person has attended screening, fill in the primary attendance date. If the person has not attended, but invitation date is recorded, fill in the primary invitation date. Otherwise fill in 1.1. of the year when person became eligible to this screening round.

variables.label: screening_round_end
variables.description: A date, when this screening round is considered to end.
variables.observations_comments: The beginning date of the next round, or if not known, x time after the beginning of the screening round.

variables.label: education
variables.description: No education, primary education, secondary education, higher education
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: income
variables.description: Income level,  at the beginning of screening round.
variables.transformations_from_origin: Notes: SNOMED-codes for income as clinical finding, probably not relevant
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: migration_status
variables.description: Migration status,  at the beginning of screening round.
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: employment_status
variables.description: Employment status  at the beginning of screening round.
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: disability_status
variables.description: Disability statys  at the beginning of screening round.
variables.transformations_from_origin: WG-SS is ECIS-desired standard but presumably not a standard OMOP vocabulary.  SNOMED could be better + not a priority
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: citizenship
variables.description: Citizenship at the beginning of screening round.
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: lgbtiqa_status
variables.description: LGBTIQA+status at the beginning of screening round
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: geo_area
variables.description: Geographic location, at the beginning of screening round.
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: deprivation_area
variables.description: Deprivation area, at the beginning of screening round.
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: preliminary_risk_score
variables.description: Risk score calculated pre-screening round using some external tool.
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: preliminary_risk_score_class
variables.description: Risk score classified pre-screening round using some external tool.
variables.transformations_from_origin: some cancer risk classifications exist on SNOMED but maybe not relevant
variables.observations_comments: The latest reliable recording of the variable at the instance just before the beginning date of screening round. Typically this can be the value recorded 31.12. of the year preceding the year person became eligible for screening. For example, if the person was invited to screening in 2022, this can be the value recorded 31.12.2021.

variables.label: primary_invited
variables.description: Indicator for the person being invited to screening during that round.
variables.transformations_from_origin: mapped as "does episode primary testing have this element"
variables.observations_comments: Fill in if the person was invited to screening or not. If you have only data on attended persons, this may be left blank. If the person has been excluded from the invitation based on some planned criteria (f.ex.: earlier attendance to opportunistic testing, protocols for surveillance due to history of negative colonoscopy), this should be coded as 2. In this case the person will be properly handled in the calculation of screening and invitation coverages.

variables.label: primary_invitation_date
variables.description: Date of invitation for primary test
variables.observations_comments: If primary_invited = 2 or 99, this should be left blank.

variables.label: primary_test_attended
variables.description: Indicator for person attending the primary test
variables.transformations_from_origin: mapped as "does episode screening_primary have this element"
variables.observations_comments: If primary_invited = 2, this should be 2 as well.

rules.name: screening_year_check
rules.description: Ensures the record belongs strictly to the 2025 screening campaign.

rules.name: round_sequence
rules.description: Validates that the screening round number is a positive integer.

rules.name: date_range_valid
rules.description: Ensures the screening round start date falls within the 2025 calendar year.

rules.name: date_chronology
rules.description: Ensures the round end date is after or equal to the start date.
rules.expression: screening_round_end >= screening_round_begin OR screening_round_end IS NULL

rules.name: attendance_logic
rules.description: Restricts previous attendance values to the allowed set (0, 1, 2, 99).

rules.name: first_round_consistency
rules.description: If it is the first round, previous attendance must be 2 (N/A).
rules.expression: CASE WHEN screening_round_number = 1 THEN screening_previous_attendance = 2 ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: history_string_format
rules.description: Validates history string containing numeric values followed by true/false labels.
rules.expression: screening_history_string::VARCHAR IN ('true', 'false') OR screening_history_string IS NULL

rules.name: invitation_strict_logic
rules.description: Ensures invitation_date exists only for invited persons (1) and is NULL for others (0, 2, 99).
rules.expression: CASE WHEN primary_invited = 1 THEN primary_invitation_date IS NOT NULL ELSE primary_invitation_date IS NULL END

rules.name: exclusion_consistency
rules.description: Enforces that protocol-excluded persons (2) must have an attendance status of 2.
rules.expression: CASE WHEN primary_invited = 2 THEN primary_test_attended = 2 ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: attendance_coherence
rules.description: Prevents 'Attended=Yes' (1) if the person was not invited (0) or was excluded (2).
rules.expression: CASE WHEN primary_invited IN (0, 2) THEN primary_test_attended != 1 ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: socioeconomic_values
rules.description: Validates categorical ranges for education (0-3, 99), income (0-4, 9, 99), and employment (0, 1, 99).
rules.expression: education IN (0, 1, 2, 3, 99) AND income IN (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 99) AND employment_status IN (0, 1, 99)

rules.name: risk_score_range
rules.description: Ensures the numerical preliminary risk score is within the 0 to 100 range.
rules.expression: preliminary_risk_score BETWEEN 0 AND 100 OR preliminary_risk_score IS NULL

variables.label: primary_id
variables.description: None

variables.label: round_id
variables.description: ID that links primary investigation data to a screening round
variables.observations_comments: Primary-table contains details related to event that is classified as part of primary testing in screening. In CRC screening this is typically either fecal occult blood test or endoscopic examination. NOTE: this is the observation that is the primary test in the protocol, not the first test that can be recorded in the screening system. For example, if your protocol has FIT as a primary test, then FIT has to be the primary test event. If primary phase is explicitly defined in your data model, thi

variables.label: primary_invited
variables.description: Indicator for the person being invited to screening during that round.
variables.observations_comments: Fill in if the person was invited to screening or not. If you have only data on attended persons, this may be left blank. If the person has been excluded from the invitation based on some planned criteria (f.ex.: earlier attendance to opportunistic testing, protocols for surveillance due to history of negative colonoscopy), this should be coded as 2. In this case the person will be properly handled in the calculation of screening and invitation coverages.

variables.label: primary_invitation_date
variables.description: Date of invitation for primary test

variables.label: primary_screening_reason
variables.description: Setting for the primary testing, routine or follow-up
variables.observations_comments: Usually 1 in CRC screening.

variables.label: primary_test_method
variables.description: Primary test method applied

variables.label: primary_test_attended
variables.description: Indicator for person attending the primary test
variables.observations_comments: If primary_invited = 2, this should be 2 as well.

variables.label: primary_test_date
variables.description: Date of attending the primary test

variables.label: primary_test_result_factor
variables.description: Primary test result, possible values depend on the primary test.
variables.observations_comments: For FIT/gFOBT, values 0, 1, 9 are acceptable. For endoscopy-based primary testing other values are accepted. If there are multiple primary FIT/gFOBTs performed, list the most relevant outcome with hierarchy 1 > 0 > 9. Similarly for endoscopy primary testing list only one outcome with hierarchy 13 > 12 > 11 > 10 > 16 > 19.

variables.label: primary_test_result_numeric
variables.description: Numeric result of primary test (eg. FIT value)
variables.observations_comments: If the test is above or below certain detection limits, provide the minimal/maximal value.

variables.label: primary_test_result_numeric_censored
variables.description: Indicator for the test result being censored due to detection limits of the laboratory equipment.
variables.observations_comments: If the test is below detection threshold, provide 0. If the exact value can be trusted, provide 1. If the test is above maximal detection threshold, provide 2.

variables.label: primary_test_complications
variables.description: Complications in the primary testing phase (typically applicaple only for primary endoscopic screening).
variables.observations_comments: Only fill in the case of primary endoscopic screening.

rules.name: primary_id_not_null
rules.description: The primary observation identifier is required.

rules.name: round_id_not_null
rules.description: The link to the screening round is required.

rules.name: invitation_attendance_logic
rules.description: If a person is excluded from invitation (2), attendance must also be marked as excluded (2).
rules.expression: CASE WHEN primary_invited = '2' THEN primary_test_attended = '2' ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: invitation_date_consistency
rules.description: Invitation date should only be present if the person was actually invited (1).
rules.expression: CASE WHEN primary_invited IN ('0', '2', '99') THEN primary_invitation_date IS NULL ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: attendance_date_requirement
rules.description: If the test was attended (1), a test date must be recorded.
rules.expression: CASE WHEN primary_test_attended = '1' THEN primary_test_date IS NOT NULL ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: result_factor_hierarchy
rules.description: Validates categorical results for FIT/gFOBT (0, 1, 9) or endoscopy (10-19).

rules.name: numeric_censored_logic
rules.description: Validates the censoring indicator (0: below, 1: exact, 2: above threshold).
rules.expression: primary_test_result_numeric_censored IN ('0', '1', '2') OR primary_test_result_numeric_censored IS NULL

rules.name: complications_scope
rules.description: Complications should only be filled for endoscopic primary screening.
rules.expression: CASE WHEN primary_test_method NOT LIKE '%endoscopy%' AND primary_test_complications IS NOT NULL THEN FALSE ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: date_chronology_primary
rules.description: The test date cannot be earlier than the invitation date.
rules.expression: primary_test_date >= primary_invitation_date OR primary_test_date IS NULL OR primary_invitation_date IS NULL

variables.label: assessment_id
variables.description: ID for the assessment.

variables.label: round_id
variables.description: ID that links assessment into a screening round
variables.observations_comments: Assessment-table contains details related to event that is classified as part of further assessment phase of screening. If further assessment phase is explicitly defined in your data model, this is the right table to map those elements. If your data is formed from external data source without explicit definitions for phases, these can be certain events that occur within certain time period after (positive) primary test. For example, all the colonoscopies within 6 months of positive FIT could be

variables.label: assessment_invited
variables.description: Indicator for person being invited to assessment test (typically colonoscopy in FIT screening)
variables.observations_comments: Fill in this field, if the program collects data on the invitation decision from the primary testing phase.For example, this can vary from test-positivity, if people with certain health conditions are not invited to further assessment. If this data is not collected, but only attendance is known, fill in 99. If data is collected but there are cases where person has attended assessment without invitation to assessment, this can be imputed as 1.

variables.label: assessment_attended
variables.description: Indicator for person attending to assessment test (typically colonoscopy in FIT screening)
variables.observations_comments: Fill in this field, if the person attended further assessment after positive initial test.

variables.label: assessment_date
variables.description: Date of person attending the assessment test (typically colonoscopy in FIT screening)
variables.observations_comments: Leave blank if the date is missing.

variables.label: assessment_method
variables.description: Method of assessment

variables.label: assessment_diagnosis
variables.description: Result of the assessment test (typically colonoscopy confirmation).
variables.observations_comments: Diagnosis based on the further assesment phase. If further assessment and treatment phase diagnosis cannot be separated, fill the eventual screening round diagnosis to this field. Same applies to rest of the variables (stage - operations)

variables.label: assessment_complications
variables.description: Any complications present at the assessment phase (typically colonoscopy).

variables.label: assessment_phase_cancer_stage
variables.description: If assessment result was cancer, the stage or TNM classification of cancer at the assessment stage.

variables.label: assessment_phase_stage_type
variables.description: Type of the recorded stage/TNM in the assessment phase.

variables.label: assessment_operations
variables.description: Operations performed at the assessment phase -- note: can be extended to multiple variables.

rules.name: assessment_id_not_null
rules.description: Unique identifier for the assessment is mandatory.

rules.name: round_id_consistency
rules.description: The round_id is required for linking with other screening phases.

rules.name: assessment_invited_catalog
rules.description: Validates invitation status: 0=false, 1=true, 99=unknown.

rules.name: assessment_attended_catalog
rules.description: Validates attendance status: 0=false, 1=true, 99=unknown.

rules.name: assessment_method_catalog
rules.description: Validates assessment method: 3=Sigmoidoscopy, 4=Colonoscopy, 5=CT-Colonography.

rules.name: assessment_diagnosis_catalog
rules.description: Validates diagnosis codes: 0=No CRC/Adenoma, 1=Small Adenoma, 2=Advanced Adenoma, 3=Cancer, 6=Other, 99=Unknown.

rules.name: assessment_complications_catalog
rules.description: Validates complications codes (0 to 17) or NULL if not applicable.

rules.name: assessment_stage_type_catalog
rules.description: Validates stage type: 1=TNM, 2=Stage.
rules.expression: assessment_phase_stage_type::VARCHAR IN ('1', '2') OR assessment_phase_stage_type IS NULL

rules.name: attendance_consistency
rules.description: Logical check: If attendance is false (0), there should be no assessment date.
rules.expression: CASE WHEN assessment_attended::VARCHAR = '0' THEN assessment_date IS NULL ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: assessment_date_format
rules.description: Ensures the date follows the YYYY-MM-DD format if provided.
rules.expression: assessment_date IS NULL OR TRY_CAST(assessment_date::VARCHAR AS DATE) IS NOT NULL

rules.name: cancer_stage_logic
rules.description: If a cancer stage is provided, the stage type (TNM or Stage) must be specified.
rules.expression: CASE WHEN assessment_phase_cancer_stage IS NOT NULL THEN assessment_phase_stage_type IS NOT NULL ELSE TRUE END

variables.label: round_id
variables.description: ID that links assessment into a screening round

variables.label: treatment_id
variables.description: Unique identifier for the treatment

variables.label: treatment_invited
variables.description: Indicator for person being invited to treatment after the assessment phase.
variables.observations_comments: Fill in this field, if the program collects data on the invitation decision from the assessment phase. If this data is not collected, but only attendance is known, fill in 99. If data is collected but there are cases where person has attended assessment without invitation to assessment, this can be imputed as 1. Note: these should be treatments initiated due to cancer screening programme. For example, having a treatment for interval cancer (f.ex. cancer after primary negative test) should not be

variables.label: treatment_attended
variables.description: Indicator for person attending the treatment after the assessment phase.
variables.observations_comments: If data on treatment attendance does not exists, leave this whole table empty.

variables.label: treatment_date
variables.description: Date of a person attending the treatment.

variables.label: treatment_type
variables.description: Treatment the person received after the further assessment phase.
variables.observations_comments: Note: this only applies to treatments given due to cancer screening. Treatments for, for example, interval cancers should not be recorded here.

variables.label: treatment_complications
variables.description: Possible complications from the treatment received, if recorded.
variables.observations_comments: Note: this only applies to treatments given due to cancer screening. Treatments for, for example, interval cancers should not be recorded here.

rules.name: round_id_not_null
rules.description: The round identifier is required for linking treatment to the screening process.

rules.name: treatment_id_not_null
rules.description: Unique identifier for the treatment is mandatory.

rules.name: treatment_invited_catalog
rules.description: Validates invitation status: 0=false, 1=true, 99=unknown.

rules.name: treatment_attended_catalog
rules.description: Validates attendance status: 0=false, 1=true.

rules.name: treatment_type_catalog
rules.description: Validates treatment codes: 1=Endoscopic, 2=Surgery, 3=Chemo, 4=Radio, 5=Combo, 99=Unknown.
rules.expression: treatment_type::VARCHAR IN ('1', '2', '3', '4', '5', '99') OR treatment_type IS NULL

rules.name: treatment_date_format
rules.description: Ensures YYYY-MM-DD format using [0-9] to avoid backslash issues. Recommended: can be NULL.

rules.name: treatment_attendance_logic
rules.description: If treatment was not attended (0), there should not be a treatment date.
rules.expression: CASE WHEN treatment_attended::VARCHAR = '0' THEN treatment_date IS NULL ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: treatment_complications_check
rules.description: Optional variable: can be NULL.

variables.label: round_id
variables.description: ID that links assessment into a screening round

variables.label: interval_id
variables.description: None

variables.label: interval_cancer_exists
variables.description: Defines wether interval cancer exists for the person.
variables.observations_comments: Only fill in this data if there is a possibility for monitoring interval cancers. The definition of an interval cancer is open at this stage of JA, but these should be cancers that are not detected due to intensified follow-up due to screening. For example, interval cancer can be a cancer some time after primary-negative.

variables.label: interval_cancer_dg_date
variables.description: Date of diagnosis for interval cancer

variables.label: interval_cancer_diagnosis_topography
variables.description: Interval cancer diagnosis, anatomical site

variables.label: interval_cancer_diagnosis_morphology
variables.description: Interval cancer diagnosis, morphology

variables.label: interval_cancer_diagnosis_factor
variables.description: Interval cancer diagnosis, classified to several factors.

variables.label: interval_cancer_tnm
variables.description: TNM classification of interval cancer
variables.observations_comments: TNM: SNOMED 734320 and children mapped directly to TNM class by their label

rules.name: round_id_not_null
rules.description: The round identifier is required to link the interval cancer to a specific screening episode.

rules.name: interval_id_not_null
rules.description: Unique identifier for the interval cancer record is mandatory.

rules.name: interval_cancer_exists_catalog
rules.description: Validates the existence flag: FALSE (No), TRUE (Yes).

rules.name: existence_dependency_logic
rules.description: Data integrity: If interval_cancer_exists is '0', all clinical details (date, topography, morphology, factor, TNM) must be NULL.
rules.expression: CASE WHEN interval_cancer_exists::VARCHAR = '0' THEN interval_cancer_dg_date IS NULL AND interval_cancer_diagnosis_topography IS NULL AND interval_cancer_diagnosis_morphology IS NULL AND interval_cancer_diagnosis_factor IS NULL AND interval_cancer_tnm IS NULL ELSE TRUE END

rules.name: interval_cancer_date_format
rules.description: Ensures the diagnosis date follows YYYY-MM-DD using [0-9] for compatibility.

rules.name: interval_diagnosis_consistency
rules.description: Recommended: If cancer exists (1), a diagnosis date should ideally be provided.
rules.expression: CASE WHEN interval_cancer_exists::VARCHAR = 'true' THEN interval_cancer_dg_date IS NOT NULL ELSE TRUE END
